body.p: There are several methods that can be used to transform JSON documents through XSLT processing.

section.title: Transforming a JSON Document Directly with XSLT

ol.li:
Create a new transformation scenarioCreate a new transformation scenario using one of the following types of transformations:
JSON Transformation with XSLTJSON Transformation with XSLT - This scenario is useful if you want to develop a JSON document and the XSLT document is in its final form.
XSLT Transformation on JSONXSLT Transformation on JSON - This scenario is useful if you want to develop an XSLT document and the JSON document is in its final form.
Configure the transformation scenario to suit your needs. In the XSLT tab, make sure you select the JSON file in the JSON URL field and the XSL file in the XSL URL field.

section.title: Transforming Multiple JSON Documents at Once
section.p: It is also possible to transform multiple JSON documents at once with XSLT processing. To achieve this, select the JSON documents in the Project view, right-click, and apply or configure a transformation scenario.

section.title: Transforming a JSON Document Using XSLT and XPath Functions

ol.li:
Create an XSLT 3.0 stylesheet that has the xsl:initial-template. You can use one of the following two templates available in the New Document Wizard.
XSLT Stylesheet for JSON - Processes a JSON document by using a json-doc() function and matches the JSON properties from the JSON map.
XSLT Stylesheet for JSON to XML - Processes a JSON document by using a json-to-xml() function and matches the converted XML content.
Create a new XSLT transformation scenario for your stylesheet.

Reference the JSON document that you want to transform using one of these two methods:
In the transformation scenario, click the Parameters button in the XSLT tab and add a parameter that specifies the URL to your JSON document in its value. For example, if you are transforming one of the built-in templates mentioned above, the input parameter is added by default and you could specify the URL in its value.
Specify the URL to your JSON document in the stylesheet you created. For example, if you use one of the built-in templates mentioned above, you would specify the URL in the value of the input parameter (in the xsl:param element).

p.note: There are some sample files in the [OXYGEN_INSTALL_DIR]/samples/json/transform folder that can be used to transform a JSON document to XML or HTML.
